param.name: in_url
param.dialogReference: Add the url to the Go.Data server that is hosting your outbreak data. E.g., https://godata-rXX.who.int

param.name: in_outbreak
param.dialogReference: Once you have entered valid credentials for Go.Data (i.e., url, username, and password), this dropdown will be populated with the outbreaks that you have available in your Go.Data account.

param.name: in_gd_outputrawfolder
param.dialogReference: This is the directory where the raw data will be downloaded.

param.name: in_gd_outputsumm
param.dialogReference: Toggle this checkbox. If active, the tool will summarize the raw data into counts by administrative area.

param.name: in_gd_outputsummfolder
param.dialogReference: If summary tables are being produced, this is the directory where the csv files will be created.

param.name: in_gd_outgdbworkspace
param.displayname: File Geodatabase Output Workspace for Features and Tables
param.dialogReference: This is the location of the file geodatabase where the feature classes (or feature tables) will be stored.

param.name: in_joingeo
param.dialogReference: Select this checkbox to join summary datasets to a shapefile.

param.name: in_geolayer
param.datatype: Feature Layer or Layer or Shapefile
param.dialogReference: The location of a shapefile that contains Location IDs that match the Location IDs in your Go.Data data model.

param.name: in_geofield
param.dialogReference: The field in the shapefile that contains LocationIDs that match the LocationIDs in your Go.Data data model.

param.name: in_keepallgeo
param.dialogReference: If active, all polygons will be kept, even if they do not have any data associated with them. If deactivated, only the polygons with data will be kept.
